missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} Doors are locked.
{-} The neutral mission markers are your informants. If there are no Imperial figures adjacent to an informant, a hero can interact with that informant ({K} or {J}) to interrogate it. During that test, that hero may suffer 1 {C} to reroll one die. A hero can spend 2 movement points to push an adjacent informant 1 space.
{-} When a hero withdraws, he is incapacitated instead. When activating, he receives only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.
{-} The mission will progress when the heroes have interrogated 2 informants.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You fly over the busy streets of Coruscant toward a rendezvous point with a group of local contacts claiming to have information on the missing Rebel team’s mission. The tall scyscrapers of the planet-city loom over you as your speeder descends toward your landing place. An old diner lies nestled between the large buildings, its doors shut. Some old crates lie strewn about, and your informants huddle in the dark corners of the streets.

Upon landing, your heart sinks when you realize your communications with your contacts must have been intercepted. A group of stormtroopers rushes out to greet you. You draw your weapons, hoping you can still get good intel out of your informants.

{-} Deploy the heroes adjacent to the speeder (blue highlights).
{-} Doors are locked.
{-} The neutral mission markers are your informants. If there are no Imperial figures adjacent to an informant, a hero can interact with that informant ({K} or {J}) to interrogate it. During that test, that hero may suffer 1 {C} to reroll one die. A hero can spend 2 movement points to push an adjacent informant 1 space.
{-} When a hero withdraws, he is incapacitated instead. When activating, he receives only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.
{-} The mission will progress when the heroes have interrogated 2 informants.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

You look around at your comrades, then down to your getaway shuttle, hovering just below you through the overpass. Taking a deep breath, you leap over the railing and down into the vehicle. With everyone aboard, the shuttle zooms away with enemy blaster fire in its wake.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Place Story Mission cards "From Dark Clutches", "On the Trail" and "Inside Man" into play.

events.eventName: End of Mission - Rebels lose - Recording Active
events.eventText:
Unable to reach your getaway vehicle, you're driven back by stormtrooper fire. Abandoning further recon, you attempt to find refuge in the seedy establishments and back alleys of the Coruscant underworld, hoping the Imperials get less intel out of your informants than you did.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 125 credits per hero.
{-} Place Story Mission cards "From Dark Clutches", "On the Trail" and "Inside Man" into play.

eventActions.mainText:
The Twi'lek woman looks at the Imperial soldiers, obviously unwilling to share her knowledge.

{-} Test {K} or {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the informant, then discard all strain tokens on the informant. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
The woman shakes her head and waves you off. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the informant for each {B} result gained.

events.eventText:
"Yeah, I've seen the guys you're talking about. They were arrested a short while ago, by some Imperial soldiers and an officer guy. The soldiers were terrifying, with huge shields and shock batons."

Having told you everything she knows, she quickly hurries off.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
A tall Twi’lek woman glances nervously around.

{-} If there are no Imperial figures adjacent to this token, a hero can interact with it ({K} or {J}) to interrogate the informant, discarding it. During that test, that hero may suffer 1 {C} to reroll one die. A hero can spend 2 movement points to push this token 1 space. (Move the token, but leave it in the app.)

eventActions.mainText:
The man is trying to hide behind some crates to avoid the Imperial soldiers.

{-} Test {K} or {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the informant, then discard all strain tokens on the informant. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
The man slips away from you and back into hiding. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the informant for each {B} result gained.

events.eventText:
"They had a meeting. The rebel group, I mean. They were discussing something important in that diner over there. Didn't have much time before the Imps stormed in. I gotta go, guys. I have a family, I can't risk any danger to them!"

The man rushes off.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
A short human man huddles in a corner.

{-} If there are no Imperial figures adjacent to this token, a hero can interact with it ({K} or {J}) to interrogate the informant, discarding it. During that test, that hero may suffer 1 {C} to reroll one die. A hero can spend 2 movement points to push this token 1 space. (Move the token, but leave it in the app.)

eventActions.mainText:
The Zabrak is out of breath. They appear to have run from the soldiers.

{-} Test {K} or {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the informant, then discard all strain tokens on the informant. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
The Zabrak gasps and shakes their head. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the informant for each {B} result gained.

events.eventText:
"A... alright", the Zabrak gasps. "Just give me a minute." After a few deep breaths, the Zabrak manages to speak again. "The rebel operatives were talking about some artifact. A shard or something. I think what they heard about it scared them. A lot. But I really gotta go."

The Zabrak runs off into the side alleys of Coruscant.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
A Zabrak is catching his breath here.

{-} If there are no Imperial figures adjacent to this token, a hero can interact with it ({K} or {J}) to interrogate the informant, discarding it. During that test, that hero may suffer 1 {C} to reroll one die. A hero can spend 2 movement points to push this token 1 space. (Move the token, but leave it in the app.)

events.eventText: From the lower levels, an Imperial combat drone ascends.
”There they are. Blast’em!”, you hear ordered through the ominous, crackling filter of a stormtrooper helmet as a second ambush emerges from behind you.

As you turn away from the second informant, a woman approaches you from the shadows. With a pang of relief you recognize the Rebel team's intelligence expert, but she is bloody and battered, with a haunted look in her eyes.

”Thank goodness you’re here!”, she says. “Part of our team was captured in their pursuit of an artifact called the Bardottan sphere. They shared with us a couple of their leads before their capture. We split up when we saw all the Imperials around. My teammate, a Duros, is in the diner and has a datacard with all the details. Hurry!”

{-} The doors are no longer locked.
{-} The mission will progress when the heroes have entered the diner.

eventActions.shortText: Search for the Duros in the diner.

eventActions.theText:
{-} When a hero withdraws, he is incapacitated instead. When activating, he receives only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.
{-} The mission will progress when the heroes have entered the diner.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText: Behind the door, a simple lower-city diner lies before you. Near a wall, a Duros is cowering in fear. Two Imperial troopers with huge riot shields surround him while an Officer is firing questions at him. As soon as you enter, the Officer looks at you. “Get rid of that Rebel scum”, he snarls.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
This door leads into a closed diner. Voices can be heard from inside.

{-} The door is locked.

This door leads into a closed diner. Voices can be heard from inside.

{-} The door is locked.

eventActions.tbText:
{-} When the <color="red">Imperial Officer</color> and the Riot Troopers are defeated, the diner is cleared.
{-} The mission will progress when the diner is cleared.

eventActions.theText:
{-} When a hero withdraws, he is incapacitated instead. When activating, he receives only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.
{-} When the <color="red">Imperial Officer</color> and the Riot Troopers are defeated, the diner is cleared.
{-} The mission will progress when the diner is cleared.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
The Duros approaches you, holding a datacard and handheld hologram projector. He hands you the card and activates the projector: the holo-recording shows a woman in robes standing in the Jedi Council Chamber. The recording is clearly very old. The Jedi speaks of a shard from an artifact with the power to enhance the connection to the Force of anyone who possesses it. The Jedi Council, fearful of the shard being misused, order it to be hidden in a secret, secure location. “Should it fall into the wrong hands”, the Jedi says, “may the Force be with us all.”

“Thank you for your help”, the Duros says, relieved. “I have analyzed the datacard and retrieved two distinct leads.  The first is a bureaucrat. a historian of the Jedi who is reported to have knowledge of ancient Jedi lore and Force-related artifacts. The other is an Imperial officer named Zaaryn, who is believed to have stumbled across information about the Bardottan sphere shard and is seeking to trade that information in the criminal underworld for personal gain. But we need to get out first, quick!”

{-} When all heroes are adjacent to the blue highlighted Overpass, click the Overpass and select "Depart".
{-} The Rebels win when the heroes depart.

eventActions.theText:
{-} When a hero withdraws, he is incapacitated instead. When activating, he receives only 1 action and can only use that action to perform a move.
{-} When all heroes are adjacent to the blue highlighted Overpass, click the Overpass and select "Depart".
{-} The Rebels win when the heroes depart.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
Your getaway shuttle hovers just below the Overpass, waiting for you.

{-} When all heroes are adjacent to the blue highlighted Overpass, click "Depart".

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Place Story Mission cards "From Dark Clutches" into play.
The threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) increases by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.
